New Records: Imam-ul-Haq is nine short of 3000 ODI runs; only Hashim Amla, Fakhar Zaman, and Shai Hope took 67 innings to reach 3000 runs; Charith Asalanka is one of the best middle-order batters, scoring 1327 runs at an average above 45 and strike rate above 90
Key Match Events: Pakistan's middle-order performed well, with Haris Rauf taking crucial wickets; Sri Lanka's bowling struggled against South Africa, and their chase was relentless; the match was pivotal for both teams' World Cup campaigns
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan head coach Grant Bradburn backed players' preparation strategies; Sri Lanka focused on bouncing back after their loss against South Africa; Fakhar Zaman and Imam-ul-Haq's form was a concern; Charith Asalanka's form and Pakistan's spinners were key points
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's win boosted their confidence; Sri Lanka's chase demonstrated their ability; the match was a significant morale booster for both teams; Imam-ul-Haq's potential return to form was noted
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hyderabad's pitch was conducive to big scores; Sri Lanka's historical poor record against Pakistan in the World Cup; weather conditions were favorable
Others: No additional significant details beyond the categories provided
